fields.summary: APIDoc: no tableView font properties supported at all. tableViewRow font-* properties not supported

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
{html}

This was first asked in Q & A and then submitted by a premium customer. Users want to be able to set font properties on a table without needing to use a label.

Q&A question:
http://developer.appcelerator.com/question/33581/bug-table-row-font...

Things to be able to set are size, font weight, and font.

{html}
fields.summary: iOS: Ability to set font properties on a tableViewRow

comments.body: See current Android behavior in screenshot in linked ticket
Note that the native feature was deprecated in iOS3. See http://developer.apple.com/library/IOs/#documentation/UIKit/Reference/UITableViewCell_Class/Reference/Reference.html
As per discussion with Don in IRC #appcelerator, this will need to be documented as Android-only.
I've checked TiUITableViewRowProxy.m file and found that it uses textLabel for "title" property which is UILabel. So UILabel can have "font" property which is not deprecated. Am I wrong?

There was a pull request for the issue but commit-er does not interested in the project anymore. I've re-organized the code and made a pull request.

See: https://github.com/appcelerator/titanium_mobile/pull/1466

Tested with iOS 5 SDK on iPhone Simulator.
By the way TIMOB-6504 is duplicate of this issue.
Community pull request merged. Credit to https://github.com/hdogan
Tested with 2.1.0.v20120606162652 on iPod 3rd gen 4.0.2 and iPad Sim 5.1
